intro: Kewa caespitosa, commonly known as the clustered kewa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its compact, tufted growth habit. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, often appearing in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming dense clumps that help it thrive in various soil conditions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
